channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Temporal graph models fail to capture global temporal dynamics
item.description: We outline our observations and propose a trivial optimization-free baseline of "recently popular nodes" outperforming other methods on all medium and large-size datasets in the Temporal Graph Benchmark.

item.title: Lyra: Orchestrating Dual Correction in Automated Theorem Proving
item.description: In addition, we introduce Conjecture Correction, an error feedback mechanism designed to interact with prover to refine formal proof conjectures with prover error messages.

item.title: C3Net: interatomic potential neural network for prediction of physicochemical properties in heterogenous systems
item.description: Understanding the interactions of a solute with its environment is of fundamental importance in chemistry and biology.

item.title: End-to-End Streaming Video Temporal Action Segmentation with Reinforce Learning
item.description: The end-to-end SVTAS which regard TAS as an action segment clustering task can expand the application scenarios of TAS; and RL is used to alleviate the problem of inconsistent optimization objective and direction.

item.title: A Content-Driven Micro-Video Recommendation Dataset at Scale
item.description: Micro-videos have recently gained immense popularity, sparking critical research in micro-video recommendation with significant implications for the entertainment, advertising, and e-commerce industries.

item.title: NLPBench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Solving NLP Problems
item.description: Recent developments in large language models (LLMs) have shown promise in enhancing the capabilities of natural language processing (NLP).

item.title: Algebraic and Statistical Properties of the Ordinary Least Squares Interpolator
item.description: Deep learning research has uncovered the phenomenon of benign overfitting for over-parameterized statistical models, which has drawn significant theoretical interest in recent years.

item.title: Deep Learning-based Analysis of Basins of Attraction
item.description: This study showcases the effectiveness of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) in characterizing the complexity and unpredictability of basins of attraction for diverse dynamical systems.

item.title: Multimodal Dataset for Localization, Mapping and Crop Monitoring in Citrus Tree Farms
item.description: In this work we introduce the CitrusFarm dataset, a comprehensive multimodal sensory dataset collected by a wheeled mobile robot operating in agricultural fields.

item.title: Maximum Weight Entropy
item.description: Under this paradigm, the epistemic uncertainty is described by the weight distribution of maximal entropy that produces neural networks "consistent" with the training observations.

item.title: Survey on Deep Face Restoration: From Non-blind to Blind and Beyond
item.description: We also discuss notable benchmarks commonly utilized in the field.

item.title: Dynamic Prompt Learning: Addressing Cross-Attention Leakage for Text-Based Image Editing
item.description: Large-scale text-to-image generative models have been a ground-breaking development in generative AI, with diffusion models showing their astounding ability to synthesize convincing images following an input text prompt.

item.title: Automatic Feature Fairness in Recommendation via Adversaries
item.description: We leverage the Adaptive Adversarial perturbation based on the widely-applied Factorization Machine (AAFM) as our backbone model.

item.title: ChatCounselor: A Large Language Models for Mental Health Support
item.description: This paper presents ChatCounselor, a large language model (LLM) solution designed to provide mental health support.

item.title: Investigating the changes in BOLD responses during viewing of images with varied complexity: An fMRI time-series based analysis on human vision
item.description: The obtained result of this analysis has established a baseline in studying how differently human brain functions while looking into images of diverse complexities.

item.title: Physics Inspired Hybrid Attention for SAR Target Recognition
item.description: There has been a recent emphasis on integrating physical models and deep neural networks (DNNs) for SAR target recognition, to improve performance and achieve a higher level of physical interpretability.

item.title: Human Kinematics-inspired Skeleton-based Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: Previous approaches to detecting human anomalies in videos have typically relied on implicit modeling by directly applying the model to video or skeleton data, potentially resulting in inaccurate modeling of motion information.

item.title: OceanBench: The Sea Surface Height Edition
item.description: It provides plug-and-play data and pre-configured pipelines for ML researchers to benchmark their models and a transparent configurable framework for researchers to customize and extend the pipeline for their tasks.

item.title: Show-1: Marrying Pixel and Latent Diffusion Models for Text-to-Video Generation
item.description: In this paper, we are the first to propose a hybrid model, dubbed as Show-1, which marries pixel-based and latent-based VDMs for text-to-video generation.

item.title: Fair Canonical Correlation Analysis
item.description: This paper investigates fairness and bias in Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA), a widely used statistical technique for examining the relationship between two sets of variables.

item.title: Confidence-based Visual Dispersal for Few-shot Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: To address this issue, recent works consider the Few-shot Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (FUDA) where only a few source samples are labeled, and conduct knowledge transfer via self-supervised learning methods.

item.title: Local Compressed Video Stream Learning for Generic Event Boundary Detection
item.description: Specifically, we use lightweight ConvNets to extract features of the P-frames in the GOPs and spatial-channel attention module (SCAM) is designed to refine the feature representations of the P-frames based on the compressed information with bidirectional information flow.

item.title: Improving Facade Parsing with Vision Transformers and Line Integration
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Comprehensive Facade Parsing (CFP), a dataset meticulously designed to encompass the intricacies of real-world facade parsing tasks.

item.title: Convolutional Networks with Oriented 1D Kernels
item.description: Specifically, we find that one key ingredient to a high-performing 1D ConvNet is oriented 1D kernels: 1D kernels that are oriented not just horizontally or vertically, but also at other angles.

item.title: GNN4EEG: A Benchmark and Toolkit for Electroencephalography Classification with Graph Neural Network
item.description: Recognizing this shortfall, there has been a burgeoning interest in recent years in harnessing the potential of Graph Neural Networks (GNN) to exploit the topological information by modeling features selected from each EEG channel in a graph structure.

item.title: A Survey of Chain of Thought Reasoning: Advances, Frontiers and Future
item.description: Chain-of-thought reasoning, a cognitive process fundamental to human intelligence, has garnered significant attention in the realm of artificial intelligence and natural language processing.

item.title: Experience and Evidence are the eyes of an excellent summarizer! Towards Knowledge Infused Multi-modal Clinical Conversation Summarization
item.description: We propose a knowledge-infused, multi-modal, multi-tasking medical domain identification and clinical conversation summary generation (MM-CliConSummation) framework.

item.title: DifAttack: Query-Efficient Black-Box Attack via Disentangled Feature Space
item.description: In addition, due to the avoidance of using surrogate models' gradient information when optimizing AEs for black-box models, our proposed DifAttack inherently possesses better attack capability in the open-set scenario, where the training dataset of the victim model is unknown.

item.title: Effective Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning Control with Relative Entropy Regularization
item.description: It alleviates the inconsistency of multiple agents' policy updates by introducing the relative entropy regularization to the Centralized Training with Decentralized Execution (CTDE) framework with the Actor-Critic (AC) structure.

item.title: Learning from Flawed Data: Weakly Supervised Automatic Speech Recognition
item.description: Training automatic speech recognition (ASR) systems requires large amounts of well-curated paired data.

item.title: Volumetric Semantically Consistent 3D Panoptic Mapping
item.description: We introduce an online 2D-to-3D semantic instance mapping algorithm aimed at generating comprehensive, accurate, and efficient semantic 3D maps suitable for autonomous agents in unstructured environments.

item.title: Free Discontinuity Design: With an Application to the Economic Effects of Internet Shutdowns
item.description: Thresholds in treatment assignments can produce discontinuities in outcomes, revealing causal insights.

item.title: Updated Corpora and Benchmarks for Long-Form Speech Recognition
item.description: The vast majority of ASR research uses corpora in which both the training and test data have been pre-segmented into utterances.

item.title: Robust Sequential DeepFake Detection
item.description: However, existing methods only focus on detecting one-step facial manipulation.

item.title: Towards Real-World Test-Time Adaptation: Tri-Net Self-Training with Balanced Normalization
item.description: Test-Time Adaptation aims to adapt source domain model to testing data at inference stage with success demonstrated in adapting to unseen corruptions.

item.title: fastMONAI: A low-code deep learning library for medical image analysis
item.description: We introduce fastMONAI, an open-source Python-based deep learning library for 3D medical imaging.

item.title: Joint Communication and Computation Framework for Goal-Oriented Semantic Communication with Distortion Rate Resilience
item.description: Recent research efforts on semantic communication have mostly considered accuracy as a main problem for optimizing goal-oriented communication systems.

item.title: REFORM: Removing False Correlation in Multi-level Interaction for CTR Prediction
item.description: We propose a CTR prediction framework that removes false correlation in multi-level feature interaction, termed REFORM.

item.title: Event Stream-based Visual Object Tracking: A High-Resolution Benchmark Dataset and A Novel Baseline
item.description: Tracking using bio-inspired event cameras has drawn more and more attention in recent years.

item.title: Synthia's Melody: A Benchmark Framework for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation in Audio
item.description: Despite significant advancements in deep learning for vision and natural language, unsupervised domain adaptation in audio remains relatively unexplored.

item.title: A Comparative Study of Population-Graph Construction Methods and Graph Neural Networks for Brain Age Regression
item.description: We conclude that static graph construction approaches are potentially insufficient for the task of brain age estimation and make recommendations for alternative research directions.

item.title: Pre-training-free Image Manipulation Localization through Non-Mutually Exclusive Contrastive Learning
item.description: We argue that contrastive learning is more suitable to tackle the data insufficiency problem for IML.

item.title: InternLM-XComposer: A Vision-Language Large Model for Advanced Text-image Comprehension and Composition
item.description: We propose InternLM-XComposer, a vision-language large model that enables advanced image-text comprehension and composition.

item.title: Structure Invariant Transformation for better Adversarial Transferability
item.description: In this work, we find that the existing input transformation based attacks transform the input image globally, resulting in limited diversity of the transformed images.

item.title: Statistical Analysis of Quantum State Learning Process in Quantum Neural Networks
item.description: As a quantum analog of probability distribution learning, quantum state learning is theoretically and practically essential in quantum machine learning.

item.title: Unidirectional brain-computer interface: Artificial neural network encoding natural images to fMRI response in the visual cortex
item.description: While significant advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) have catalyzed progress across various domains, its full potential in understanding visual perception remains underexplored.

item.title: Advanced Volleyball Stats for All Levels: Automatic Setting Tactic Detection and Classification with a Single Camera
item.description: Our frameworks combine setting ball trajectory recognition with a novel set trajectory classifier to generate comprehensive and advanced statistical data.

item.title: SLIQ: Quantum Image Similarity Networks on Noisy Quantum Computers
item.description: Exploration into quantum machine learning has grown tremendously in recent years due to the ability of quantum computers to speed up classical programs.

item.title: Navigating Text-To-Image Customization:From LyCORIS Fine-Tuning to Model Evaluation
item.description: Text-to-image generative models have garnered immense attention for their ability to produce high-fidelity images from text prompts.

item.title: Forgetting-aware Linear Bias for Attentive Knowledge Tracing
item.description: This problem arises from the bias that overprioritizes the correlation of questions while inadvertently ignoring the impact of forgetting behavior.
